title: Boost Your Immune System: Try this unique immunity boosting Ayurvedic drink to stay safe from COVID-19
description: There are a lot of potent Ayurvedic herbs and supplements used and renowned for their anti-viral properties.
cleaned_text: way to boost your immunity? Are you on the lookout to buy supplements or herbs to boost your immunity and stay safe from coronavirus? Well, we have an easy solution for you! In trying times like these, when we are all worried about keeping our immunity in the best possible shape, taking a little help from Ayurveda can prove to be immensely helpful. [readmore](javascript://) 02/10How can Ayurveda help Ayurveda has been a trusted measure in the fight against coronavirus. Clinical trials for the usage of ashwagandha, along with other fortified medicinal herbs such as guduchi, yastamidhu are being studied as a prophylactic medicine by the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) in collaboration with Ministry of AYUSH. [readmore](javascript://) 03/10Ayurvedic clinical trials are going on In another try, a group of researchers from IIT Delhi, in collaboration with a scientific university from Japan are studying the usage of ashwagandha in the production of a vaccine against COVID-19. There are a lot of potent Ayurvedic herbs and supplements used and renowned for their anti-viral properties. We talked to an Ayurvedic practitioner, Dr Vishakha Mahendru, who talked about one such powerful remedy useful in the times of coronavirus. We tell you about one such drink you can make at home using a few ingredients which are full of benefits: [readmore](javascript://) 04/10How to prepare this Ayurvedic concoction All you need is some water and ingredients, which are all easily available. What do you need: -Kalmegh -Chirata powder -Giloy -Tulsi Beej -Mulethi Boil a glass of water in a pan. Take half a tablespoon of each of these ingredients and mix it in the boiling water. Let it simmer down well and once done, cool it. Strain your solution and consume the drink. You can also choose to soak the ingredients in water overnight and consume it fresh the next morning. Both methods work well. If you find the taste a little bitter or pungent to your liking, you can add a spoonful of honey in the drink, which again, is a powerful immunity-boosting elixir for the body. [readmore](javascript://) 05/10Benefits of this drink We have already told you how Ayurveda can come in handy to benefit your body holistically without causing any of the side-effects which are associated with traditional allopathic medicines. All of the ingredients used in the drink work in different ways in helping get the toxins away and benefitting the immune system. [readmore](javascript://) 06/10Kalmegh Kalmegh, a bitter-tasting plant leave is known as an antioxidant which promotes anti-inflammatory activity in the body. It is a useful herb used in fighting a nasty cold, flu and other upper respiratory tract infections. It balances the body's Kapha and pitta and helps soothe digestion, getting rid of any toxins. It is also said that regular consumption of kalmegh powder can help detoxify the body. [readmore](javascript://) 07/10Guduchi Giloy Guduchi Giloy, another helpful ingredient used in this drink is again, a natural fever suppressant. It possesses anti-inflammatory, anti-cancer, antipyretic, anti-oxidant and immunomodulatory properties. Some of the clinical trials done so far have found that giloy leaves can help deal with some of the symptoms associated with COVID-19. Giloy has also been associated to cut down on stress and anxiety levels, which can be encountered easily. [readmore](javascript://) 08/10Chirayta Chirayta, a very common Ayurvedic herb is used by practitioners for its varied anti-inflammatory properties. Apart from this, what's wonderful is that it has strong anti-asthmatic and expectorant properties, which are vital in getting rid of any congestion and pollutant from the respiratory tract as well as airways, reducing any discomfort caused. [readmore](javascript://) 09/10Tulsi seeds Ayurveda also considers Tulsi, or holy basil as one of the most enriching herbs. Known to balance Kapha in the body, it is helpful in regulating sputum production, has anti-viral properties and also stimulates the digestive system. If you face trouble finding Tulsi beej, you can also add in Tulsi leaves in making the concoction. [readmore](javascript://) 10/10Mulethi Lastly, the addition of mulethi in this drink ensures that any problems associated with a sore throat or a dry cough are taken care of. It has strong properties which can soothe an irritated throat and strengthen your immunity.
